contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and Yahweh put all of Og's people under our control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and all his people were put under our control

contextId.information: Moses compares Yahweh's anger to someone starting a fire to destroy things. This can be stated in active form. To kindle anger is a metaphor for becoming very angry. AT: "Yahweh your God will kindle his anger" or "Yahweh your God will become very angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: the anger of Yahweh your God will be kindled against you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until you have destroyed them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: until they are destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you have many more things" or "you have many more possessions" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: all that you have is multiplied

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh wrote on them the same words he had said to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: on them was written everything just like all the words that Yahweh announced to you

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. AT: "that is where they buried him" or "the Israelites buried him there" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: there he was buried

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the priest will pour out the blood of the sacrifice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the blood of your sacrifices will be poured out

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "after Yahweh destroys them before you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: after they are destroyed from before you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one must ever rebuild the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it must never be built again

contextId.information: If a person could not repay their debts, they sometimes sold themselves into slavery to pay what they owed. This can be stated in active form. AT: "sell themselves to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: is sold to you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must not have any yeast among you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: No yeast must be seen among you

contextId.information: This may be stated in active form. AT: "If you find someone" or "If there is anyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If there is found

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "if someone tells you about this disobedient act" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: if you are told about this

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "someone has done such a horrible thing in Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: such an abomination has been done in Israel

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Do this so that family members do not kill an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Do this so that innocent blood is not shed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If someone finds a person whom someone else has killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If someone is found killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and nobody knows who attacked him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and it is not known who has attacked him

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "him whom someone has killed" or "the dead body" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: him who has been killed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "a valley where nobody has plowed the ground or planted seeds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: a valley that has been neither plowed nor sown

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the heifer whose neck the priests broke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: the heifer whose neck was broken

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: Possible meanings are 1) "and the man loves one of his wives and he hates the other wife" or 2) "and the man loves one wife more than he loves the other wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and one is loved and the other is hated

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "if the firstborn son belongs to the wife whom the man hates" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: if the firstborn son is of her that is hated

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you execute him" or "you kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: he is put to death

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: Possible meanings are 1) "because God curses everyone whom people hang on trees" and 2) "people hang on trees those whom God has cursed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: for whoever is hanged is cursed by God

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and if somebody finds out what happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: and if they are discovered

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and no one is to force him to live away from his home and do any kind of work" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: neither may he be commanded to go on any forced duty

contextId.information: This is an idiom for "If a man kidnaps." It can be stated in active form. AT: "If you find a man kidnapping" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If a man is found kidnapping

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "all of the instructions that I have given you and that the priests, who are Levites, teach you to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: every instruction given to you which the priests, the Levites, teach you

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must not execute the parents because of something bad that one of their children did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: The parents must not be put to death for their children

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you should only execute a person because of something bad that he did himself" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: everyone must be put to death for his own sin

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If the judge orders them to beat the guilty man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If the guilty man deserves to be beaten

contextId.information: This may be stated in active form. AT: "then the judge would humiliate your fellow Israelite in front of all of the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: then your fellow Israelite would be humiliated before your eyes

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "then the family of the dead man must not let the widow marry someone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: then the wife of the dead man must not be married off to someone

contextId.information: This is the statement the Levites must shout to all the people of Israel. It may be stated in active form. AT: "May Yahweh curse the person ... sets it up in secret" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May the man be cursed ... sets it up in secret

contextId.information: This may be stated in active form. AT: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May the man be cursed

contextId.information: This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:16|27:16]]. AT: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May the man be cursed

contextId.information: This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:16|27:16]]. AT: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May the man be cursed

contextId.information: This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:16|27:16]]. AT: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May the man be cursed

contextId.information: This may be stated in active form. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:27:16|27:16]]. AT: "May Yahweh curse the man" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: May the man be cursed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will curse you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Cursed will you be

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Yahweh will curse" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Cursed will be

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "until it destroys you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: until you are destroyed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The peoples of the other nations will drive you from one nation to another" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: You will be tossed to and fro among all the kingdoms

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "from which no one will be able to heal you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: from which you cannot be healed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will give your sons and your daughters to other peoples" or "Your enemies will take your sons and daughters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Your sons and your daughters will be given to other peoples

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that no one will be able to cure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: from which you cannot be cured

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "where no one can sow seed and the crops do not bear fruit" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: where nothing is sown or bears fruit

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that I have written" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that are written

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "that he has revealed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: that are revealed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "I will devour them" or "I will allow their enemies to devour them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: they will be devoured

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "their descendants will not forget to keep it in their mouths" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will not be forgotten from the mouths of their descendants

contextId.information: The idiom "forget it from the mouth" means to stop speaking about it. AT: "their descendants will not stop speaking about it to each other" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it will not be forgotten from the mouths of their descendants

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The abstract noun "hunger" can be translated as the verb "be hungry." AT: "They will grow weak and die because they are hungry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: They will be wasted by hunger

contextId.information: Possible meanings of "burning heat" are 1) the Israelites will suffer from fevers or 2) the weather will be unusually hot during a drought or famine. This can be stated in active form. AT: "They will ... hunger, and burning heat and terrible disasters will devour them" or "They will ... hunger, and they will die from burning heat and terrible disasters" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: They will ... hunger and devoured by burning heat and bitter destruction
